full_summary:
**Detailed Seismic Evaluation of the Embassy of Canada to Jamaica**
===========================================================

### Tender Information

* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01013814
* **Solicitation Number**: 23-221645
* **Publication Date**: 2022-11-17
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2022-12-16T15:00:00 (Expired)
* **Trade Agreements**: This tender is open to contractors who have a trade agreement with Canada, including:

  * Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
  * Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
  * Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
  * Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
  * Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
  * Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)

### Contract Description

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is seeking a qualified contractor to provide Architectural and Engineering Services for the detailed seismic evaluation of the official residence for the Embassy of Canada to Jamaica. This contract will be awarded to a qualified supplier under the terms of the DFATD Supply Arrangement (SA) AWT-AESVCS-STRUCT-15129/B.

### Evaluation Criteria

Evaluation will be based on the contractor's ability to provide the required services, including a detailed seismic evaluation of the official residence. A comprehensive review of the contractor's proposal, including their approach, methodology, and technical capabilities, will be conducted.

### Contracting Entity Information

* **Contracting Entity Name**: Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department of)
* **Contact Information**:
	+ Name: Irena Stevic
	+ Email: irena.stevic@international.gc.ca
	+ Phone: 343-203-2582

### Attachments

The tender package, including the detailed requirements and terms of the contract, can be found at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/11/17/1c1953809ab165c05539df567bd638cd/23-221645_-_npp.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/11/17/1c1953809ab165c05539df567bd638cd/23-221645_-_npp.pdf)

Please note that the tender has expired, and no further submissions will be accepted. However, the information provided may still be of interest to contractors
